alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Chesterfield; Edgefield; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; McCormick; Richland; Saluda; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 29 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia, including the following areas, Burke, Columbia, Lincoln, McDuffie and Richmond. Portions of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Aiken, Bamberg, Barnwell, Calhoun, Central Orangeburg, Chesterfield, Clarendon, Edgefield, Kershaw, Lee, Lexington, McCormick, Northwestern Orangeburg, Richland, Saluda, Southeastern Orangeburg and Sumter. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Hurricane Idalia will bring heavy rainfall to the Midlands and Central Savannah River Area beginning Wednesday afternoon and continuing into Thursday. Rainfall amounts will range from 3 to 7 inches with some locally higher amounts just over 8 inches. The heaviest rain is forecast to fall along and south of I-20. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Aiken; Chesterfield; Edgefield; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; McCormick; Richland; Saluda; Sumter
